thread.title: Watch DraftExpress' breakdowns of Terps Diamond Stone, Jake Layman and Melo Trimble
thread.title_full: Watch DraftExpress' breakdowns of Terps Diamond Stone, Jake Layman and Melo Trimble

author: Jonas Shaffer
title: Watch DraftExpress' breakdowns of Terps Diamond Stone, Jake Layman and Melo Trimble
text:
NBA 
It's just about time for college basketball season, which means the time to obsess over NBA draft prospects' wingspans, work ethics and everything in between is also upon us. 
Maryland is almost unanimously considered a preseason top-five team this season, in no small part because of its next-level talents. The Terps are one of just three teams with at least two prospects in DraftExpress' top 25 for 2016 ; Kentucky (three) and Kansas (two) are the others. 
Because NBA teams draft on professional potential, not college production, Maryland's top prospect might not even start the team's season opener. Freshman center Diamond Stone, behind incumbent Damonte Dodd at the center position, is considered the 10th-best prospect in the 2016 class, followed by senior forward Jake Layman (No. 25) and sophomore point guard Melo Trimble (No. 36). 
If you've got some time to kill and don't mind hearing the same instrumentals over and over, watch full scouting reports of the Terps' big three, courtesy of Mike Schmitz . 
Diamond Stone (No. 10 overall, No. 1 in Big Ten Conference, No. 3 center) 
Jake Layman (No. 25 overall, No. 6 in Big Ten, No. 7 small forward) 
Melo Trimble (No. 36 overall, No. 7 in Big Ten, No. 9 point guard) Please enable Javascript to watch this video
